casebody.data:
Sidney Welk v. The State. No. 8097. Decided January 16, 1924. Rehearing denied March 26, 1924.

The opinion states the case.

No brief on file for appellant. Tom Garrard and Grover C. Morris, Assistants Attorney General, and Shelby S. Cox, District Attorney, for the State. HAWKINS, Judge.

Conviction is for the unlawful manufacture of whisky. Punishment, two years in the penitentiary.

*654This is a companion case to Belcher v. State, No. 8092, this day decided. The facts and the questions of law are identical. The purported bill of exception relative to examination of jurors bears the same notation by the learned trial judge as the bill to the same proceeding in the Belcher case.

For the same reasons given in the opinion in that case the judgment here must be affirmed and it is so ordered.

Affirmed.

ON REHEARING.

HAWKINS, Judge.

Appellant’s motion for rehearing is overruled for the same reasons given for overruling a similar motion in Belcher v. State, (No. 8092, opinion on rehearing March 5th,' 1924).

Overruled.
